text: Thank you - that is very good to know! That is somewhat different from how the FDA has portrayed it, and I will keep it in mind for future stories
author: sashachavkin

text: Got it, thanks. Do you know if that is what happened in all 24 of the cases the FDA has recorded as smooth-surfaced? If so it seems like that is something the FDA should state publicly...

text: FDA hearings on breast implant safety start Monday. We wrote an explainer to give straight facts on a key issue that the FDA & regulators worldwide are struggling to answer - whether textured breast implants are safe #ImplantFiles
author: sashachavkin

text: The Italian government takes action in response to the #ImplantFiles, including creating a registry for breast implants
author: sashachavkin

text:
The full meeting materials, including a detailed agenda & FDA summary of the evidence, are here. I will be covering the hearings live on Twitter and also at http://icij.org  - send me any questions, thoughts or info that we should consider!

text: The panel is a group of FDA-selected experts who will then make recommendations after the hearing. These recs often guide policy but the FDA is not required to follow them

text: The FDA posts meeting materials for next week's hearing on breast implant safety. Among the questions the panel will consider are risk factors for BIA-ALCL, risk profile of textured implants and how to address breast implant illness symptoms #ImplantFiles

text: I think the biggest issue is whether patients are informed about the risks. Many women I've spoken with say they would have made different choices if they had been told before getting implants about breast implant illness and ALCL. But they weren't informed.
author: sashachavkin

text: This from the FDA stands out in particular: "We believe the current evidence, although limited, suggests some individuals may be predisposed to develop an immune/inflammatory reaction when exposed to select materials."
author: sashachavkin

text:
Perhaps most striking is the change in the FDA's tone on breast implant illness, which just a few months ago it strongly suggested did not exist. Now it says it needs more info to communicate risk and minimize harm
